question: What are the fees associated with selling on eBay?
answer: eBay charges a final value fee of 13.25% or lower depending on the category, plus a per order fee ($0.30 for orders $10.00 or less, and $0.40 for orders over $10.00). Insertion fees may apply if you list more than 250 items per month.

question: When will I be charged selling fees?
answer: Insertion fees, including optional listing upgrade fees, are charged at the time your item is listed. Final value fees are charged once your item sells.

question: How can I boost my listings on eBay?

question: What happens if I set a reserve price for my auction listing?
answer: If you set a reserve price on an auction-style listing, you will be charged a reserve fee at the time of listing, regardless of whether your item sells.

question: How are final value fees calculated?
answer: Final value fees are calculated as a percentage of the total amount of the sale, including the cost of the item, shipping, sales tax, and other applicable fees, plus the per order fee.

question: How do I receive my payouts from eBay?
answer: Payouts are sent directly to your linked bank account. You can choose your payout schedule to be daily, weekly, biweekly, or monthly.

question: What happens to my funds when I sell an item on eBay?
answer: When you sell an item, eBay deducts selling costs and fees from your funds before initiating the payout. You can view details of your payouts, including related fees, in the Payments tab in Seller Hub.

question: Can I use my eBay earnings to pay for shipping labels?
answer: Yes, you can use your available funds to purchase shipping labels for the items you sell. If your available funds are insufficient, eBay will charge the remaining balance to your payment method on file.

question: What is the process for changing my payout schedule?
answer: You can change your payout schedule in the Payments tab in Seller Hub. You have options for daily, weekly, biweekly, or monthly payouts.

answer: To qualify as a Top Rated Seller, you must maintain an active eBay account for at least 90 days, complete 100 or more transactions with $1,000 in sales during the previous 12 months, and meet specific defect and late shipment rates.

question: What are product identifiers, and why are they important in my listing?

question: What should I include in the title of my tablet listing?

question: How can I optimize my tablet listing for search results?

question: What are some tips for taking quality photos of my tablet?

question: Why is competitive pricing important for my tablet listing?
answer: Competitive pricing is critical to the overall buyer experience and is one of the most important factors for driving consideration and conversion for your mobile device. It helps attract buyers and can influence their decision to purchase.

question: What should I include in my item description to build trust with buyers?
answer: In your item description, include detailed information such as brand names, styles, model numbers, unique qualities, modifications made to the device, battery life, and potential flaws. Additionally, showcase your seller credentials and any customer service you may offer.

question: What are product identifiers?
answer: Product identifiers are unique codes created by the product manufacturer that can be used to identify a specific product. They include Universal Product Codes (UPCs), Stock Keeping Units (SKUs), International Standard Book Numbers (ISBNs), and Manufacturer Part Number (MPN).

question: When are product identifiers required on eBay?
answer: Product identifiers are required when you’re listing in most categories on eBay.

question: What should I do if my product does not have a product identifier?
answer: If you are listing a product that has no identifier or you aren’t sure what it is, you can simply select 'Does not apply'.

question: How do product identifiers benefit my eBay listings?
answer: The biggest benefit of adding product identifiers to your listings is that it increases the chances of a buyer finding your item, allowing buyers to easily find and compare what's available.

question: What should I do if I have live listings without product identifiers?
answer: If you selected 'Does not apply' or didn’t have the product identifier handy when you created your listing, it’s worth spending the time to go back and fill in any product identifiers to future proof your eBay listings.

question: What are the benefits of adding videos to my listings?
answer: Videos can act as your 24/7 salesperson, engaging with potential buyers, answering their most common questions, and showcasing your products. They help prevent common buyer issues and returns, give buyers confidence in the condition and quality of your products, and deliver a more engaging shopping experience.

question: How can I make my video effective for my listing?
answer: Since you can only add one video to a listing, it's important to choose the right content. Consider common questions, pain points, or reasons your buyers might hesitate, and use videos to let your products speak for themselves, answer common questions, share the vision behind your products, build trust in your brand, and tell the story behind your product.

question: Where can buyers see the videos on my eBay listing?

question: What types of content should I include in my product video?

question: Why should I use videos instead of just text and images?

question: How can I link my social media accounts to my eBay account?

question: What types of content can I create for my social media posts?

question: Is it possible to schedule posts for later on eBay's Seller Hub social page?

question: What is the benefit of using the automatic posting feature?

question: How do I get insights on buyers visiting my listings from social media?

question: Why are quality photos important for my eBay listings?

question: What are some best practices for taking photos of my items?

question: How can I improve my mobile phone photography for eBay listings?

question: What is eBay’s Background Removal Tool and how does it work?

question: What are eBay's photo requirements for listings?
answer: eBay requires that every listing has at least one photo, a minimum photo size of 500 pixels for the longest side, no borders or added text/artwork in photos, and stock photos can only be used for brand-new items.

question: What is the eBay Partner Network?
answer: The eBay Partner Network is eBay’s affiliate marketing program that allows users to increase their earnings by sharing their listings outside of eBay.

question: How can I earn commissions through the eBay Partner Network?
answer: You can earn commissions by driving traffic to your eBay listings through affiliate links you create using eBay Partner Network tools, and if a buyer completes a Qualifying Transaction, you will receive a commission.

question: What qualifies as a Qualifying Transaction?
answer: A Qualifying Transaction can occur if a buyer makes a purchase within 24 hours after clicking your affiliate link for a Buy It Now item, places a bid on an Auction item within 24 hours and wins it within 10 days, or if the seller accepts a Best Offer placed within 24 hours after clicking your link.

question: Can I share eBay Partner Network links on eBay listings?
answer: No, eBay Partner Network links can only be posted outside of eBay and cannot be included in eBay listings, eBay stores, or eBay Messages.

question: When will I receive my earnings from the eBay Partner Network?
answer: Earnings are paid out once per month on the 10th of the month for the month prior. For example, your earnings for May will be paid on July 10.

question: What are eBay research tools?

question: What features does Sourcing Insights offer?

question: Is Product Research available to all eBay sellers?

question: What can I do with the insights from Sourcing Insights?

question: Do I have to enroll in eBay International Shipping to sell internationally?

question: What should I consider when selling to a non-English speaking country?

question: What happens to my items once they reach the eBay shipping hub?

question: What is the 2019 Packaging Act (VerpackG)?
answer: The 2019 Packaging Act (VerpackG) requires business sellers to license the packaging for their products and register with the LUCID database when they sell items to customers in Germany.

question: What steps do I need to take to comply with the Packaging Act?
answer: To comply with the regulations, you need to license your packaging, register with the LUCID database, and add your LUCID ID number to your eBay seller account.

question: Do I have to license all types of packaging?
answer: Yes, the Packaging Act applies to all packaging placed on the German market, and all companies, including SMEs, are legally required to license their packaging.

question: What is the purpose of the licensing fee I have to pay?
answer: The licensing fee pays for the disposal and recycling of your packaging from the point of sale to the time it is disposed of as waste.

question: What does the Central Agency Packaging Register (ZSVR) do?
answer: The Central Agency Packaging Register (ZSVR) oversees compliance with the Packaging Act by maintaining the LUCID database, and it can issue warnings, impose fines, or ban sales if irregularities occur.

question: What is the Global Shipping Program and how does it help sellers?

question: What are buyer groups?

question: What are the benefits of using buyer groups?
answer: Buyer groups give you more control over who receives your coded coupons, help build loyalty, offer private discounts, promote seasonal inventory, and allow you to control your budget with options like minimum spend and expiration dates.

question: How can I create a buyer group?

question: What is the process for sending coded coupons to buyer groups?
answer: To send coded coupons to specific buyer groups, select an existing coded coupon campaign or set up a new one, add a custom message, and send your coupons to eligible buyers in your groups.

question: How often can a buyer receive a coupon from me?
answer: Each buyer can only receive one coupon from you in any 14-day period.

question: What are coded coupons?
answer: Coded coupons enable you to offer your buyers a discount through a coupon code. They help encourage repeat purchases, control your budget, and protect your margins.

question: How can I share my coded coupons?
answer: You can share your coded coupons publicly on eBay or privately off eBay. Public coupons are visible on search results, listings, and checkout pages, while private coupons can be printed or sent directly to specific buyers.

question: Can I control the budget and usage limits for my coded coupons?
answer: Yes, you can control your budget and set usage limits on the coupons. You can designate a campaign budget, minimum spend, maximum number of redemptions, maximum discounts, and expiration dates.

question: How do I create a coded coupon?
answer: If you are an eBay Store subscriber, you can create a coded coupon by going to the Marketing tab on Seller Hub, selecting 'Discounts,' and then choosing 'Coupon' from the drop-down menu.

question: What happens when my coupon discount spend approaches the budget limit?
answer: When the coupon discount spend reaches 90% of the budget limit, the campaign is paused and is no longer shown on eBay. However, you can keep the budget open to allow buyers to take advantage of the discount until the end of the discount period.

question: What are sale events and how can they benefit my sales?
answer: Sale events allow you to create a sale by grouping relevant inventory together, displaying before and now prices on your listings for a limited time. This can boost your conversion rates and help drive sales of new stock, attract new buyers, and clear out old inventory.

question: How do buyers know when there is a sale event discount?
answer: Discounts are prominently displayed in various places on eBay, including in red font in the list view after searching or browsing, on the View item page, shopping cart, checkout page, and on your store’s Discounts page.

question: Can I run more than one offer at a time on eBay?
answer: Yes, multiple offers may apply to a given item or sets of inventory, but the buyer will only see one offer message displayed at a time.

question: What is the limit of SKUs that can be listed in an offer?
answer: You can list up to 500 SKUs with each Order Offer.

question: How do I create a sale event on eBay?
answer: To create a sale event, navigate to the Seller Hub, select the Marketing tab, click on the Create discount button, choose Sale event, and follow the prompts to set your discount type, duration, and the items you want to include.

question: What is the purpose of the Offers to Buyers tool?
answer: The Offers to Buyers tool in Seller Hub enables you to start the negotiation process with interested buyers, helping to improve your conversion rate by targeting those who have shown interest in your product.

question: How can I automatically send offers to interested buyers?
answer: You can set up the auto-send feature when creating an offer, which allows you to automatically send the same offer to future interested buyers every 48 hours until the listings end or you cancel the auto-send option.

question: What is the difference between Offers to Buyers and Best Offer?
answer: Best Offer is an option selected at the time of listing that allows buyers to negotiate, while Offers to Buyers is a tool used to make private offers to eligible buyers who are watching your listings.

question: What items are eligible for sending offers to buyers?
answer: Eligible listings include items that a buyer opts to watch or items that have been added to the cart for at least five days.

question: Can I make an offer that only applies to shipping costs?
answer: No, sending an offer applies only to the item price and does not include shipping. You can adjust the offer price to offset the shipping cost.

question: What are order size discounts?
answer: Order size discounts are an effective way to increase your average order size or transaction amount by offering a discount for a minimum order size, which encourages buyers to spend more.

question: What tips can help create successful order size discounts?
answer: To create successful order size discounts, set thresholds slightly above your average order size, use percentage discounts rather than dollar amount discounts, group related items, and ensure your dollars-off discount isn't higher than the price of the least expensive item.

question: How can buyers find out about order size discounts on eBay?
answer: Buyers can find order size discounts prominently displayed in various places on eBay, including in red font in the list view, on the view item page, shopping cart, checkout page, and your store’s Promotion and All Offers pages.

question: What information can I find in eBay’s Seller Hub Discounts dashboard?
answer: In eBay’s Seller Hub Discounts dashboard, you can see your overall discount performance, including base sales, discounted sales, and sales lift, and you can filter by offer type and status or download reports.

question: Why do buyers respond better to percentage-off discounts?
answer: In general, buyers respond better to a percentage-off discount over a dollar amount discount.

question: What are the benefits of offering shipping discounts?
answer: Offering shipping discounts can increase buyers’ cart size, prominently display promotions, notify buyers of available offers in their cart, and provide flexibility to set discounts that work with your listings.

question: How can I create urgency with my shipping discount offers?
answer: Creating a shipping discount with a limited period creates a sense of urgency and may encourage buyers to make quicker purchasing decisions, especially during holidays and prime selling seasons.

question: Where can I find shipping discounts on eBay?
answer: Shipping discounts can be accessed via Seller Hub > Marketing > Create a discount > Shipping discount.

question: Can I set purchase conditions for buyers to qualify for free shipping?
answer: Yes, you can set purchase requirements such as no minimum, minimum purchase amount, or minimum purchase quantity for buyers to qualify for free shipping.

question: What should I expect with the new experience for shipping discounts?
answer: Sellers will be able to increase sales volume and drive more conversions by offering conditional or time-bound free shipping, and they will have the ability to edit their active campaigns.

question: What is volume pricing?
answer: Volume pricing is a strategy that incentivizes buyers to purchase more items by offering discounts based on the quantity bought, allowing buyers to select multiple units with one click and automatically applying the reduced price.

question: What are some benefits of using volume pricing?
answer: Volume pricing can increase average order size, improve profit margins, and provide buyers with a sense of getting a great deal, especially when free delivery is offered for multiple units shipped together.

question: How can I create a volume pricing discount on eBay?
answer: To create a volume pricing discount on eBay, eBay Store subscribers can go to the Marketing tab on Seller Hub, select 'Discounts', choose 'Order Size Discount' from the drop-down menu, and specify which listings to include in the discount.

question: Where can buyers find information about volume discounts?
answer: Buyers can see available volume discounts prominently displayed in red font in the list view after searching or browsing, as well as on the View item page, Shopping cart, Checkout page, and the store’s Discount and All Offers pages.

question: What tips should I consider when creating successful volume discounts?
answer: When creating successful volume discounts, consider timing your sale with peak months or events, ensuring you have enough stock and maintaining a useful profit margin on the items.

question: What are some valuable shipping tips for new eBay sellers?
answer: Experienced sellers offer 5 valuable shipping tips for new sellers.

question: How can I prepare my shipment for success on eBay?
answer: Learn how to make eBay shipping work for you with information on packaging and measuring your item, handling times, and calculating your shipping cost.

question: Can I choose my preferred carrier for shipping on eBay?
answer: Yes, you can ship with your preferred carrier and never pay retail rates again with eBay Labels.

question: Where can I find answers to my shipping questions on eBay?
answer: Have questions about shipping on eBay? We’ve got the answers you need in the Shipping FAQs.

question: What should I consider when calculating my shipping cost on eBay?
answer: You should consider packaging, measuring your item, and handling times when calculating your shipping cost.

question: How can I calculate my item's shipping costs?
answer: You can use our shipping calculator to easily estimate how much it would cost to ship a certain item.

question: What are the advantages of offering free shipping?
answer: Buyers often expect free shipping and are more likely to choose an item with free shipping over one with a shipping fee, even if the total cost is the same.

question: What should I consider when choosing my shipping settings?
answer: The shipping type you choose appears in your listing and determines the shipping fees your buyer will pay; you should pick the option that fits your needs best.

question: How does combined shipping work?
answer: Combined shipping allows you to reduce shipping costs for buyers who purchase more than one item by charging a higher shipping cost for the first item and a lower cost for each additional item.

question: Why is it beneficial to offer expedited shipping options?
answer: Buyers are often willing to pay more for expedited shipping services, especially when shopping last minute, which can boost your chances of capturing more sales.

question: Why is packaging important for my business?
answer: Secure, professional packaging can boost your seller ratings and drive repeat sales by making your business appear extra polished.

question: What are the key measurements I need for shipping?
answer: You need to measure the length, width, height, and weight of the package. Always round up to the nearest whole number for these measurements.

question: What is DIM weight and how is it calculated?
answer: DIM weight is calculated by taking the package’s height x length x width, divided by the applicable carrier DIM divisor. It is not the package’s weight on a scale.

question: How can I prevent shipping label price adjustments?
answer: To avoid adjustments, ensure that the dimensions and weight you provide match the actual package measurements, and familiarize yourself with your carrier’s fees for non-standard packaging.

question: What should I do if I want to reuse boxes for shipping?
answer: Only reuse boxes that are in excellent condition and ensure all previous markings and labels have been removed or covered to prevent delivery delays or returns.

question: What is handling time?
answer: Handling time is the number of days between when you receive payment for an item and when your package is scanned by your shipping carrier.

question: How can I set my listing's handling time?
answer: In the Seller Hub, click on Listings, select the listing you want to update, click on Edit fields, select Handling time from the dropdown menu, and then choose your preferred time from the Handling time dropdown menu.

question: Why is it important to choose a quick handling time?
answer: Choosing the quickest handling time you can consistently meet makes your items more attractive to buyers, as they expect fast and reliable delivery.

question: What happens if I do not meet my handling time?
answer: If you do not meet your handling time, your item could be delivered late, making your buyer dissatisfied, and it could impact your seller rating.

question: What is a smart shipping tip regarding handling time?
answer: Offering and delivering same-day handling or 1-day handling, along with at least a 30-day money-back return policy, can help you qualify for a Top Rated Plus discount and seal.

question: What items are considered hazardous materials when shipping?
answer: Items such as lithium batteries, flammable liquids, weapons, perishables, perfumes, nail polish, hairspray, cleaning supplies, firearm accessories, knives, swords, lighters, auto accessories, and plants or seeds are considered hazardous materials.

question: How should I ship packages containing lithium batteries with USPS?
answer: Packages containing lithium batteries can only be sent via Ground Advantage. You must take these items to a counter or schedule a pickup, and they need to be marked 'Restricted electronic device' and 'Surface transportation only.'

question: What happens if I don't follow hazmat shipping instructions?
answer: Not following hazmat shipping instructions could result in USPS rejecting the package, delaying delivery, confiscating the item, imposing fines, or causing eBay seller restrictions or suspension.

question: How do I declare hazardous materials when using eBay Labels?
answer: To declare a hazardous material shipment on eBay Labels, click 'Edit' and select the applicable classification from the dropdown menu. Available shipping services will be limited based on the type of item being shipped.

question: What should I avoid when packaging items for shipping?
answer: You should avoid reusing boxes with old hazmat stickers for non-hazmat items, as it could cause the package to be returned to sender.

question: What are the weight limits for Priority Mail®?
answer: The weight limit for Priority Mail® is up to 70 lbs.

question: How can I schedule a USPS pickup for my eBay Labels?
answer: You can schedule your pickup one day in advance by 2:00 a.m. CST.

question: What should I do to avoid surcharges when shipping with USPS?
answer: You should package, weigh, and measure your item carefully and update dimensions as needed before purchasing your eBay Labels postage.

question: What is ShipCover Insurance and how does it benefit eBay sellers?
answer: ShipCover Insurance offers eBay sellers coverage for their shipments up to $1,000 and allows them to track shipments and process claims quickly, all in one place.

question: What are the requirements for USPS cubic pricing?
answer: To qualify for USPS cubic pricing, packages must weigh less than 20 pounds, have a cubic feet volume up to 0.5 cubic foot for Priority Mail, or up to 1.0 cubic foot for Ground Advantage, and each side must measure 18 inches or less.

question: What is FedEx 2Day One Rate?
answer: FedEx 2Day One Rate offers predictable flat rate shipping for packages and paks, with the added benefit that sellers can use free FedEx packaging or their own generic supplies, and all zones are priced the same.

question: Can I use FedEx One Rate to ship to Alaska and Hawaii?
answer: No, FedEx One Rate is available for shipments within the contiguous U.S. only.

question: What are the weight limits for FedEx 2Day One Rate shipments?
answer: For boxes, you can ship up to 50 lbs. each and up to 2200 cubic inches. For paks, the limit is also 50 lbs. each, up to 650 cubic inches.

question: How can I calculate shipping costs for my item?
answer: You can use the shipping calculator provided to easily estimate how much it would cost to ship a certain item.

question: Are there any surcharges with FedEx One Rate pricing?
answer: No, FedEx One Rate pricing already includes any applicable fuel, residential, and delivery area surcharges.

question: What are the key benefits of using UPS for eBay Labels?
answer: Key benefits of using UPS for eBay Labels include savings on retail rates, the ability to drop off packages at UPS Store retail locations using QR Codes, access to over 78,000 UPS Access Point locations, and proactive tracking with automated shipping updates and delivery alerts.

question: How can I calculate my item's shipping costs with UPS?
answer: You can use the shipping calculator provided by UPS to easily estimate how much it would cost to ship a certain item.

question: What is the transit time for UPS Ground service?
answer: UPS Ground service has transit times between 1 to 5 business days, with Saturday delivery standard to most residential addresses.

question: What items are prohibited to ship with UPS?
answer: There are certain prohibited items that UPS won’t ship due to laws or regulations. For more information on specific items, you can refer to the UPS resources on prohibited or restricted shipping.

question: Can I get proof of delivery for my UPS packages?
answer: Yes, UPS provides proof of delivery options including Delivery Confirmation, Signature Required, and Adult Signature Required.

question: How does eBay International Shipping simplify the process for sellers?
answer: Sellers only need to ship items safely to the domestic eBay International Shipping hub, as eBay handles international logistics, customs paperwork, and restrictions on their behalf.

question: What happens if my item is lost or damaged during international transit?
answer: If your item is claimed as lost or damaged during international transit, you won’t be at fault.

question: Can I choose which countries to exclude from shipping using eBay International Shipping?
answer: Yes, you can manage your shipping exclusions through your Shipping preferences, Business Policies, or by revising your listings.

question: Am I responsible for managing returns when using eBay International Shipping?
answer: No, eBay handles returns for you with eBay International Shipping. Your sale is considered complete once the item is received undamaged at the domestic shipping hub.

question: What should I do if I receive a combined shipping order?
answer: All items in a single order should be packaged together for shipping and properly identified for export and import. Do not combine items from several orders even if they are for the same buyer.

question: What items are eligible to be shipped using the eBay standard envelope service?
answer: As of Nov 2023, the eligible categories include Patches, Stickers & Decals, Greeting Cards, Seeds, Trading Cards, Coins & Currency, Postcards, and Stamps.

question: What are the maximum dimensions and weight for an envelope to qualify for eBay standard envelope shipping?
answer: The envelope must be no smaller than 3.5” x 5”, no larger than 6.125” x 11.5”, and no heavier than 3 oz.

question: What type of tracking is provided with eBay standard envelope shipments?
answer: eBay standard envelope service includes integrated, limited tracking for orders, which is uploaded onto the printed shipping label.

question: What should I consider when packing items for eBay standard envelope shipping?
answer: Envelopes need to be flexible enough to bend, have a uniform thickness not greater than ¼ inch, and should not contain plastic, strings, or closures.

question: How can I ship my envelope using eBay standard envelope service?
answer: You can drop your envelope off at any USPS location, mailbox kiosk, or inside your home mailbox with the flap up; an acceptance scan is not required.

question: What options do I have for setting up my returns policy?
answer: You can choose your own returns policy, offering anything from no returns to 60-day free returns.

question: How will I be notified of a return request from a buyer?
answer: You’ll get notified at the email address on your account and in your eBay Messages.

question: What should I do if a buyer requests a return?
answer: You have three business days to respond and resolve the return request.

question: What is the eBay Money Back Guarantee?
answer: The eBay Money Back Guarantee protects buyers if their item didn’t arrive, is faulty or damaged, or doesn’t match the listing, requiring you to provide a replacement, return, or refund.

question: How can I reduce the chances of buyer dissatisfaction?
answer: You can reduce the chances of buyer dissatisfaction by setting proper expectations and securely packaging your item.

question: How can I save on shipping costs during the holiday season?
answer: You can save on shipping costs by using eBay Labels, which offers discounted rates from major carriers.

question: What should I do to ensure my listings are competitive during the holidays?
answer: You can help your listings stand out by offering eBay Labels’ discounted rates with calculated shipping, which keeps your total costs competitive.

question: What happens if there are carrier delays during the holiday shipping season?
answer: As long as you meet your handling-time commitments, you’ll receive credit for on-time shipping regardless of carrier delays. eBay reviews carrier delays down to the ZIP code level and adjusts estimated delivery dates for you.

question: What are some essential tips for holiday shipping?
answer: Make sure to meet your handling times, ship with the specified service, pack items securely, and use standard-sized packaging whenever possible.

question: Are there additional costs I should be aware of during the holiday shipping season?
answer: Yes, carriers typically add fees during peak season, and you can find details about how this impacts eBay Labels in the eBay Community.

question: What benefits do Top Rated Sellers receive?
answer: Top Rated Sellers get exclusive benefits that can help boost your listings visibility, improve conversion, save money, and protect you from abusive buying behavior and events outside your control.

question: How does eBay help sellers with returns?
answer: eBay provides sellers with a set of tools that make it easy to manage returns and help provide the best customer experience possible to buyers.

question: What happens to my seller's performance feedback if defects occur through no fault of my own?
answer: Your seller’s performance feedback and profile will remain unchanged when defects occur through no fault of your own.

question: What is Seller Help and what does it offer?
answer: Seller Help is a self-service resource that lets you conveniently manage refunds, returns, 'Item not received' and 'Item not as described' cases, and other common selling issues all in one place.

question: How does eBay protect sellers from abusive buyers?
answer: eBay works to protect sellers by identifying buyers who file unusually high numbers of cases and offering protection when shipping within your stated time.

question: What is considered a defect in a transaction?
answer: A defect is a part of a transaction that eBay considers to have created a bad shopping experience for buyers.

question: How can I be protected when a buyer claims they did not receive an item?
answer: You will be protected if you shipped within your stated handling time and provided tracking information that shows proof of delivery before the case was escalated to eBay.

question: What happens to buyer feedback if an eBay Money Back Guarantee case is resolved in my favor?
answer: Any buyer feedback (positive, neutral, and negative) along with detailed seller ratings will be removed promptly from transactions in which an eBay Money Back Guarantee case is resolved in your favor by eBay.

question: What are some reasons that defects can be automatically removed from my performance standards?
answer: Defects can be automatically removed if the buyer did not pay, an eBay Money Back Guarantee request is ruled in your favor, the defect was due to an eBay site issue, or if eBay takes action on a buyer for violating policies.

question: How can I track my transaction defects?
answer: You can track your transaction defects through the Transaction Defect Report, which provides daily updates synced with your seller dashboard.

question: How will I be notified when a buyer opens a return?
answer: We’ll notify you through Messages and in My eBay.

question: What options do I have for my return policy?
answer: You can choose to offer no returns, 30-day buyer-paid returns, 30-day free returns, 60-day buyer-paid returns, 60-day free returns, or 14-day returns in limited categories.

question: What happens if I don't accept returns on my listings?
answer: If your listings don’t offer returns, we will not automatically accept the return. However, if the buyer claims the item arrived damaged, faulty, or doesn’t match the listing, you will still need to resolve their issue.

question: How can I issue a refund for a return request?
answer: You can easily issue a refund directly from your Return Details screen after inspecting the returned item.

question: When will eBay automatically issue a refund on my behalf?
answer: eBay may automatically issue a refund if the item’s tracking information shows confirmed delivery, 2 business days have elapsed, and the refund has not yet been issued to the buyer.

question: What is Seller Help?
answer: Seller Help is a self-service resource that lets you conveniently manage refunds, returns, 'Item not received' and 'Item not as described' cases, and other common selling issues all in one place.

question: Can I access Seller Help from mobile devices?
answer: Yes, Seller Help can be accessed from desktop and mobile devices.

question: What functionalities does Seller Help currently offer?
answer: With Seller Help, you can manage refunds, returns, and 'Items not received' and 'Item not as described' cases, submit requests to eBay to review feedback and defects for removal, see recent policy notifications, report buyers who abuse eBay policies, and request a selling limit increase.

question: How do I start using Seller Help?
answer: You can start using Seller Help by getting to it directly or from the homepage of the Help pages, then selecting an option you need help with.

question: Is it mandatory to use Seller Help?
answer: No, you do not have to use Seller Help. You can still use Seller Hub and My eBay just as before, as the same functionality is available in Seller Help.

question: What is eBay Guaranteed Fit?
answer: eBay Guaranteed Fit is a program designed to protect buyers and sellers from challenges associated with fitment issues for parts and accessories sold on eBay Motors.

question: What are the benefits of eBay Guaranteed Fit for sellers?
answer: Benefits for sellers include fewer returns, a free return label for fitment issues, and potentially increased sales due to enhanced buyer experience.

question: How can I participate in eBay Guaranteed Fit?
answer: Participation is optional. To participate, sellers must add compatibility information to their listings and handle returns according to the program guidelines.

question: What items are excluded from eBay Guaranteed Fit?
answer: Tires and wheels are currently excluded from eBay Guaranteed Fit.

question: What happens if a buyer opens a return for an item that doesn’t fit their vehicle?
answer: If an item arrives and doesn’t fit, the buyer can open a return request using the 'Doesn’t fit my vehicle' return reason, and if eligible, they will receive a free return label from eBay.

question: What is eBay's approach to managing payments?
answer: eBay is managing payments so that sellers have one place to sell and get paid, and buyers have more options to pay with.

question: What options do sellers have regarding Store subscriptions on eBay?
answer: Sellers can choose a Store subscription that has the right tools and benefits that’ll help them grow their sales.

question: Who can benefit from eBay's Store subscriptions?
answer: Both business and casual sellers can benefit from eBay's Store subscriptions.

question: How can I learn about fees and payments on eBay?
answer: You can learn all you need to know about fees, payments, and earnings on eBay through their resources.

question: What are the benefits of eBay managing payments for sellers?
answer: The benefits include having one place to sell and get paid, as well as providing buyers with more payment options.

question: How can I request a payout of my available funds?
answer: You can request a payout by clicking on the Request Payout button next to your Available funds in the Payments tab in Seller Hub.

question: What are the processing times for payouts to my bank account?
answer: Funds sent to your bank account typically arrive within normal bank processing times, which is usually 1-3 business days.

question: Can I get my funds immediately on my debit card?
answer: Yes, you can request an express payout to your linked Visa or Mastercard debit card, and funds typically arrive within 30 minutes, although a fee applies.

question: If I'm on a daily payout schedule, can I request a payout on demand?
answer: No, if you’re on a daily payout schedule, you won’t be able to request withdrawal of your available funds on demand since you already have the fastest scheduled payout option.

question: Is there a fee for express payouts to my debit card?
answer: Yes, an express payout fee applies to each payout to your debit card.

question: What are the benefits of having an eBay Store subscription?
answer: eBay Store subscriptions offer benefits like your own online store, more free listings, lower final value fees, marketing tools, and support for branding and customer loyalty.

question: How can I determine which eBay Store option is right for me?
answer: You can determine the right eBay Store option by answering two simple questions about how many items you plan to list each month and which description closely matches your eBay selling.

question: What is the difference between a Basic Store and a Premium Store?
answer: A Basic Store costs less and provides 1,000 free fixed-price listings per month with a 25¢ insertion fee for additional listings, while a Premium Store offers 10,000 free fixed-price listings per month with a 10¢ insertion fee for additional listings.

question: Can I change my eBay Store subscription level easily?
answer: Yes, changing your eBay Store subscription level is not difficult. You can go to My eBay, click on Account, then Subscriptions, and select 'Change level' to upgrade or downgrade.

question: What support options are available for Anchor and Enterprise Store subscribers?
answer: Anchor and Enterprise Store subscribers have access to dedicated customer support by phone and email whenever they need it.

question: What are Seller Updates on eBay?
answer: Seller Updates provide insights to help grow your business on eBay, covering topics such as listing and promoting, new tools, regulations, fees, financials, shipping, and more.

question: How can I learn about my tax obligations as an eBay seller?
answer: You can learn about your tax obligations by referring to the tax information section provided for eBay sellers.

question: Where can I connect with other eBay sellers for advice?
answer: You can connect with other sellers and specialists by joining the eBay Community, where you can ask questions and find answers.

question: What resources are available for seasonal selling on eBay?
answer: The seasonal playbook offers up-to-date tips, best practices, and tools for selling success throughout the year, including information on retail trends and peak selling periods.

question: How can I get personalized help with my eBay transactions?
answer: You can use eBay Help to ask a question or sign in to receive personalized suggestions based on your most recent transactions.

question: What updates do I need to make to my listings if I sell to buyers in the EU and Northern Ireland?
answer: You need to update your listings to comply with the General Product Safety Regulations.

question: How can I improve the quality of my product photos on eBay?
answer: You can create studio-quality photos for free with eBay's latest AI background enhancement tool.

question: What new feature helps me monitor the success of my discounts?
answer: The redesigned Summary and Discount pages allow store subscribers to easily monitor the success of their discounts.

question: What is the new item value limit for eBay International Shipping to Canada?
answer: eBay International Shipping has an increased item value limit for transactions to Canada.

question: What improvements have been made to the payment process for auction sales?
answer: There are new improvements to the payment process that allow sellers to get paid for auction sales more efficiently.

question: How can I enhance my listing photos on eBay?
answer: You can use eBay’s AI background enhancement tool available on the eBay app to create studio-quality photos by selecting from multiple AI-generated backgrounds.

question: What new features are available for eBay Store subscribers?
answer: eBay Store subscribers can access new Summary and Discounts pages, which provide streamlined navigation, an overview of active discounts, and performance metrics to optimize their marketing campaigns.

question: What is the sell-through rate metric in the Product research tool?
answer: The sell-through rate metric allows you to see the percentage of similar items sold during a specific period, helping you estimate how quickly items are selling to price your own items effectively.

question: What types of discounts can I offer as an eBay seller?
answer: You can offer various discounts such as sale events, coupons, exclusive offers to buyers, volume pricing, and order discounts like 'Buy 2 get 1 free'.

question: How do I access the Product research tool on eBay?
answer: You can access the Product research tool on mobile by going to the Selling tab in the eBay app and selecting the Research icon, or on desktop by opting into Seller Hub and navigating to the Research tab.

question: What is Flexible Cash Advance?
answer: Flexible Cash Advance is a new financing option from eBay Seller Capital that allows sellers to easily access funds for their business, with available capital ranging from $5,000 to $2 million.

question: How does the payment structure work for Flexible Cash Advance?
answer: Payments for Flexible Cash Advance are calculated based on a pre-agreed percentage of your gross sales on eBay, meaning you only pay when you make sales.

question: Will using Flexible Cash Advance affect my credit score?
answer: No, using Flexible Cash Advance will not impact your credit score as it involves a soft credit pull during the application process.

question: What is the new item value limit for eBay International Shipping to Canada?
answer: The item value limit for eBay International Shipping to Canada will increase from $2,500 to $11,400.

question: How can I apply for Flexible Cash Advance if I don't receive a pre-approved offer?
answer: If you don't receive a pre-approved offer, you can apply directly with eBay's financing partner, Liberis, and could be approved within 24 hours.

question: What are the recent updates to the Feedback Policy?
answer: The recent updates to the Feedback Policy include the removal of negative or neutral feedback in more situations, specifically when a buyer asks to cancel an order and the seller denies the request, or when a buyer changes their mind about a purchase and references being charged for an eBay return label.

question: How much coverage does ShipCover insurance now provide?
answer: ShipCover insurance now provides coverage for items valued up to $5,000.

question: What is the process to purchase ShipCover insurance?
answer: To purchase ShipCover insurance, go to Orders in My eBay, select the item to ship, choose Print shipping label, select Additional liability coverage, choose ShipCover Insurance, enter the coverage amount, and then purchase the shipping label.

question: Are there any countries excluded from ShipCover insurance?
answer: Yes, ShipCover insurance does not insure shipments to Belarus, Cote D'Ivoire (Ivory Coast), Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Myanmar, Russian Federation, Sudan, Syrian Arab Republic, and Zimbabwe.

question: What should I do if an item I shipped with ShipCover is lost or damaged?
answer: If an item is lost or damaged, you should go to Seller Hub, click on Shipping Labels under the Orders tab, find the shipping label for the item, and select 'Create Claim' under More Actions to fill out the claim form.

question: How can I access the new Marketing tab?
answer: From your Seller Hub on desktop, navigate to the Marketing tab and click on 'Summary.' You'll only see the updated Marketing tab if you have a Basic or higher Store subscription.

question: What are some of the promotional tools available to eBay Store subscribers?
answer: eBay Store subscribers have access to six unique promotional tools: volume pricing, sale events, coupons, offers to buyers, order discounts, and shipping discounts.

question: What is the difference between advertising and promotions on eBay?
answer: Advertising refers to your Promoted Listings campaigns, which will soon live under the new Advertising tab. Seller Hub Promotions are a suite of marketing tools that allow you to offer discounts to your buyers.

question: What new features can I expect in the Advertising tab?
answer: The new Advertising tab will include a redesigned Advertising dashboard, real-time performance data, personalized campaign recommendations, and a simplified campaign creation process.

question: Can I still access promotional tools if I'm not an eBay Store subscriber?
answer: All sellers who use Seller Hub can still send offers to buyers, set up volume discounts, and benefit from tailored recommendations, but a broader range of promotional tools is available only to eBay Store subscribers.

question: How can I access Product Research on my mobile device?
answer: Make sure you have the latest version of the eBay app on your iOS or Android device. Next, navigate to the Selling tab in the app on your mobile device and scroll to find the Product Research section. Tap on 'Get started' to begin your initial search.

question: What features are included in the new desktop messaging experience?
answer: The new messaging experience includes all previous messages between you and your buyers connected on the same thread for context, an updated search feature, a streamlined inbox for easier navigation, and a cleaner display.

question: What is the benefit of using Product Research for eBay sellers?
answer: Product Research equips sellers with key market insights, highlighting trends, demand, and competition, enabling them to make informed decisions, optimize pricing, and improve listing strategies.

question: When will the new earnings report be available on eBay?
answer: You can keep an eye on your Seller Hub Payments tab and My eBay Payments for your new earnings report over the next few weeks.

question: Is Venmo available as a payment method for all buyers on eBay?
answer: No, Venmo is only available to buyers located in the US.

question: What information do I need to include for products sold in the EU and Northern Ireland under the General Product Safety Regulation?
answer: You need to include the product manufacturer's name and contact information, details of an EU or NI-based Responsible Person if the manufacturer is not located in the EU or NI, relevant product information like model number and CE marking, and safety and compliance information in the local language.

question: How does eBay International Shipping simplify the process of selling internationally?
answer: eBay International Shipping allows sellers to ship items to a domestic hub, after which eBay handles logistics, paperwork, returns, and refunds, making it easier for sellers to reach a broader audience without managing complex international shipping requirements.

question: What is the role of the Responsible Person in the context of the General Product Safety Regulation?
answer: The Responsible Person is responsible for ensuring compliance with product safety regulations, including checking technical documentation, informing authorities about dangerous products, cooperating with market surveillance, and providing evidence of compliance checks when requested.

question: What changes are being tested for auction sales to improve payment processing?
answer: Changes being tested require buyers to set up a preferred payment method and shipping address before placing a bid, and after winning, they have one hour to adjust their order or payment details; otherwise, the order will be processed automatically.

question: What should I do if I need to find a Responsible Person for my products sold in the EU or NI?
answer: You can contact the manufacturer or your upstream supplier to obtain the name and contact details of the EU or NI-based Responsible Person, or check with your EU or NI subsidiary or importer if applicable.

question: What new recommendations are being introduced to help sellers?
answer: New 'Sell it faster' recommendations and easier access to sale events are being introduced.

question: How long will drafts of my listings be saved after their last update?
answer: Drafts of your listings will now be saved for 75 days after their last update.

question: What changes have been made to improve feedback organization?
answer: The most relevant feedback is now shown first, buyers can add images to their feedback on listings with multiple quantities, and replies to feedback are now visible on mobile, in the eBay app, and desktop.

question: What improvements have been made to shipping on eBay?
answer: eBay Standard Envelope has been expanded into more categories, shipment tracking has been upgraded for better delivery expectations, and guidance during shipping exceptions has been included for both regular and return shipments.

question: What mobile features have been added to help sellers manage their business?
answer: Sellers can now sort orders by Custom SKU and by buyer on the eBay mobile app, making it easier to find inventory and combine items for shipping.

question: How long will my listing drafts be saved?
answer: Drafts of your listings will now be saved for 75 days after their last update.

question: What happens if I don't make changes to my drafts?
answer: If you don't make changes to your drafts within 75 days of creating them, they will be automatically deleted.

question: How many drafts can I save using the quick listing tool?
answer: You can save up to 250 drafts through the quick listing tool on eBay.com and the eBay mobile app.

question: What is the maximum number of drafts I can save in Seller Hub?
answer: You can save up to 5,000 drafts through the single and bulk business listing tools in Seller Hub.

question: How can I check how much time I have left before my draft is deleted?
answer: You can see how much time you have left before your draft is deleted by checking the Expiration date column on the Manage drafts page.

question: How can I create a sale event from the Active Listings tab?
answer: From your Seller Hub Active Listings tab on desktop, choose either the 'Actions' or 'Sell it Faster' menu and select 'Create Sale Event.' You can then select listings to add, and choose your sale event’s dates and percentage discount.

question: What new features are available for sellers on the Active Listings tab?
answer: Sellers with a Basic or higher Store subscription can now create markdown sale events directly from the Active Listings tab, and all sellers will start seeing personalized 'Sell it faster' recommendations with actionable tips to help sell items faster.

question: When will I be able to create sale events on the eBay app?
answer: The ability to create sale events on the eBay app will be rolled out over the coming weeks, initially available on the iOS app and then expanding to the Android app in the following months.

question: What should I do if I want to snooze 'Sell it faster' recommendations?
answer: You can select the 'Remind me later' button to snooze the recommendations for a few days.

question: Do I have access to all sale event features when creating a sale event from the Active Listings tab?
answer: No, when you access sale events through the Active Listings tab, you can only create sale events or add listings to existing sale events. To access advanced features like rule-based sales events, you need to use the sale events tool in the Marketing tab.

question: What is changing when I send offers to buyers?
answer: With this change, buyers will need to complete payment to accept your offer. Until then, the item will remain available for other potential buyers to purchase or make offers.

question: How does the new payment requirement help sellers?
answer: This change will help reduce unpaid item incidents by requiring buyers to pay for the item in order to accept your offer.

question: What is multi-user account access (MUAA)?
answer: MUAA is an eBay feature that lets you grant permissions to other eBay users without compromising the security of your account. Users must have their own eBay accounts and passwords to access specific workflows and perform actions on your behalf.

question: What are the benefits of using an authenticator app for 2-step verification?
answer: An authenticator app helps verify your identity with device-bound, time-based, one-time passcodes (OTP) that reduce the risk of unauthorized access to your eBay account and are more secure than traditional methods like SMS or email OTPs.

question: What should I do if I lose my phone after setting up an authenticator app?
answer: We recommend adding your email and phone number as a backup method of verification so you can authenticate prior to re-enrolling into the authenticator app on your new device.

question: What new features are being introduced in the Fall Seller Update?
answer: The Fall Seller Update introduces new features to help sellers reach more buyers, enhance their listings, and improve the selling experience, including innovations in listing management and new Promoted Listings features.

question: How can I promote my listings more effectively?
answer: You can promote your listings more effectively by utilizing the new dynamic bidding strategy for Promoted Listings Advanced and by introducing Smart Promoted Listings Advanced campaigns.

question: What changes have been made regarding shipping?
answer: There are new updates that make it easier to ship internationally.

question: What are the updated requirements for business sellers selling to European buyers?
answer: The Fall Seller Update includes updated requirements for registered business sellers who sell to European buyers.

question: What is the new feature related to offers on the eBay app?
answer: Sellers can now send offers in bulk using the eBay app.

question: What improvements have been made to reduce unpaid items for Buy It Now and Best Offer listings?
answer: We’ve increased the price threshold for Buy It Now items that require immediate payment and now all buyers must add a payment method when making offers on Best Offer listings.

question: Will I still have unpaid items after these changes are implemented?
answer: While the goal is to reduce unpaid items, they may still occur from time to time in specific scenarios.

question: What do I need to do to comply with the Digital Services Act for EU buyers?
answer: Log into your Account Settings on My eBay and navigate to the Public business information page to update your business contact details.

question: What information will be shown on my listings for EU buyers?
answer: Your business name, business address, verified email, phone number, and, where relevant, business registration number will appear on your listings for EU buyers.

question: Can I opt out of the feature that requires buyers to provide payment information upfront?
answer: Yes, you can opt out of this feature in Buyer Payment Requirements, but it is recommended to remain opted in to ensure quicker payments and order creation.

question: How can I opt in to receive a paperless Form 1099-K?
answer: Log into your account. You’ll see a notification banner in Seller Hub and My eBay prompting you to opt-in to receive a paperless Form 1099-K.

question: What happens if my email address is incorrect and I opted for a paperless Form 1099-K?
answer: If the email bounces back, we’ll mail you a paper copy.

question: When will my paperless Form 1099-K be available for download?
answer: Your Form 1099-K will be made available by January 31, and you’ll receive a notification via email when it is issued.

question: Can I change my mind after opting in for a paperless Form 1099-K?
answer: Yes, you can opt out at any time by changing the option located on the Taxes page from My eBay or under the Payments tab in Seller Hub.

question: How long will I have access to my paperless Form 1099-K?
answer: You’ll be able to access your paperless 1099-K forms for the previous 12 years.

question: What is combined shipping for eBay International Shipping?
answer: Combined shipping allows buyers' shipping costs to be determined by the weight and size of their entire order, rather than separately for each individual item.

question: How will offering different international shipping choices benefit buyers?
answer: It will allow buyers to select their preferred shipping method at checkout and pay applicable import charges at checkout or defer them until delivery.

question: What happens if a buyer selects a non-eBay International Shipping option?
answer: If a buyer selects the non-eBay International Shipping option, the seller will be charged the international selling fee and will be responsible if the item gets lost or damaged in transit, or if the buyer requests a return.

question: Are there any items that cannot be combined into one order?
answer: Yes, items from certain categories, such as goods containing lithium-ion batteries, might be excluded from combined shipping due to dangerous goods regulations.

question: What is the maximum order value eligible for eBay International Shipping?
answer: Currently, items up to $2,500 are eligible for eBay International Shipping, and the total order value (including shipping costs) shouldn't exceed $2,500.

question: What new features are being introduced for Promoted Listings Standard?
answer: Two new features for Promoted Listings Standard are being announced to help sellers stay competitive in the marketplace.

question: When does eBay Open 2023 start?
answer: eBay Open 2023 will begin on September 26 with in-person attendance, followed by three virtual event days from September 27-29.

question: How can I report inappropriate messages from other members?
answer: There is an added report button for inappropriate messages from members to help you manage your interactions.

question: What resources are available for resolving issues with unpaid items?
answer: More seller resources for resolving issues with unpaid items have been introduced.

question: What should I know about eBay International Shipping?
answer: Important details about eBay International Shipping are provided in the updates.

question: What improvements have been made to the payment dispute process?
answer: Sellers can now add details and explain their reason for challenging a payment dispute with up to 1000 characters and upload up to 5 separate files of supporting documentation.

question: How can I report inappropriate messages on eBay?
answer: You can report a message directly from your conversation by selecting 'Report message' from the message menu and indicating the category the message applies to, such as offensive, scam, threatening, or unwanted.

question: What are the requirements for selling items in France under EPR regulations?
answer: If you sell items in France, you are required to add your Unique Identification Number (UIN) to your account and ensure your listings include the required information to stay visible on eBay.fr.

question: How many days do I have to respond to a payment dispute?
answer: You have 5 calendar days to respond to a payment dispute.

question: What happens if I don’t provide the required information for listings in Germany?
